intro: Galium biebersteinii, commonly known as the lesser bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. Galium biebersteinii thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
